vocabulary.translation: to be born on a happy star (very lucky/fortunate)

exampleSentence.georgian: ის ბედნიერ ვარსკვლავზე ბოლოვნებაა - მან ლატარეა მოიგო!
exampleSentence.transliteration: is bednier varsk'vlavze bolovnebaa - man lat'area moigo!
exampleSentence.translation: He/She is born on a happy star - he/she won the lottery!

vocabulary.notes: One of the most beautiful Georgian idioms. Expresses deep admiration for someone blessed with good fortune throughout life.

exampleSentence.georgian: როდესაც გამოცდას ვერ ჩავაბარე, ყურები ჩამოეცვა.
exampleSentence.transliteration: rodesac gamotsdas ver chavabare, q'urebi chamoets'va.
exampleSentence.translation: When I failed the exam, my ears dropped (became very sad).

vocabulary.notes: Creates vivid image of someone slumping with visible disappointment. Very commonly used.

exampleSentence.georgian: ჩემი მეგობარი ვირიან თავზე დაჯდომაა - არ დავტოვებს თავის დამოკიდებულებას.
exampleSentence.transliteration: chemi megobari virian tavze dajdomaa - ar davt'oebs tavs damok'idebulebas.
exampleSentence.translation: My friend is sitting on a donkey's head - he/she won't give up their position.

vocabulary.notes: Humorous idiom perfectly capturing willful stubbornness. Used both affectionately and critically.

exampleSentence.translation: These artists have hand for music (are talented).

vocabulary.notes: Part of Georgian 'hand' expressions describing skill/talent. Can specify 'for something' or general talent.

exampleSentence.georgian: ჩემი მეგობარი გული აქვს ბრძოლისათვის - ყოველთვის იბრძვის.
exampleSentence.transliteration: chemi megobari guli aqvs brdzolisat'vis - qovelt'vis ibrdzvis.
exampleSentence.translation: My friend has heart for battle - always fights/struggles.

vocabulary.notes: Reflects Georgian warrior culture values. Expresses deep respect for inner strength and determination.

exampleSentence.georgian: ჩემი დედა წვერი აქვს - იცის ყველაფერი.
exampleSentence.transliteration: chemi deda ts'veri aqvs - its'is q'velaperi.
exampleSentence.translation: My mother has beard - knows everything (is wise).

vocabulary.notes: Respectful idiom for wisdom. Can be used for both men and women. Reflects traditional wisdom symbols.

exampleSentence.translation: These children have fire exchanged! (are extremely energetic).

vocabulary.notes: Describes incredible vitality and energy. Often used for children or very active people.

exampleSentence.translation: This topic is in a fog of confusion (very unclear).

vocabulary.notes: Used when things are very confusing or unclear. Literary and expressive.

exampleSentence.translation: Our plans, everything floats in water (very uncertain).

vocabulary.notes: Describes instability or uncertainty. Often used for uncertain future plans.

vocabulary.translation: I don't know the border (I'm excessive)

exampleSentence.georgian: საკვებში საზღვარი არ ვიცი - ვჭამ ბევრს.
exampleSentence.transliteration: sak'vebshi sazghvari ar vitsi - vch'am bevrs.
exampleSentence.translation: I don't know the border in food - I eat a lot.

vocabulary.notes: Humble admission of not knowing limits or going too far. Self-deprecating humor.
